page.title: 15INDUSTRY AROUND STAINLAND
page.content: {CLOCK FACE QUARRY (CONT.) The wagons arrive approximately every ten minutes and take the aggregate to{Marshalls}at{Southowram} where it is crushed again into sand. This is then used by Marshalls to make concrete products. There are a lot of other quarry sites in our area, but these are now disused. {BURY MILL Bury Mill is at the bottom of the valley beside Black Brook.It makes fine woollen cloth which is used to make ladies' coats.Over 40% of the cloth is exported in rolls and more is exported once it has been made into coats. It is an old family firm owned by George Wheelwright.It employs about 80 people.They import Australian wool because it is the best quality.
